user review from tv.com:
The Bottom Line: "Underappreciated"
A long forgotten masterpiece that takes well-known fairy tales and puts an unforgettable and totally unique spin on them through the comic genius of Rik Mayall and some very artistic animation. ...Continue Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â»

It's going to take me a minute to get started here. I am a little nervous about trying to review such a unique example of a "childrens" television series. You know what I can't believe? That nobody else has yet gotten round to commemorating this ingenious creation by means of a review.
What's going on, people?
Anyway, let's get down to business here.
The essential quirky spark necessary to transform the show from a dull re-telling of classic fairy tales to ten minutes of condensed comedy (suitable for kids and still funny for... "older" kids) is provided by Mr. Mayall. His unique story-telling method ensures the audience sits entranced for the duration, and the highly imaginative animation techniques used to accompany his wacky talents don't do any harm either.
In other words, everyone should enrich their lives by watching this comic gem.
So do it. Do it now, before it's too late!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
